text.text: how do i create claim?

text: To create a claim, you can view all incomplete claims on the Dashboard. Click "Pick claims" and then pick the date of the import.

text.text: launch me to create claim page

text: Link: ClaimImports/CreateNewClaim

text.text: What should I do if a record already exists for the patient when creating a claim?

text: If a record already exists for the patient, you should go to the patient's Account page and click on the "Create a claim" link. Initiating the creation of a claim from the Account page fills in all the patient information for you. It is not only faster but also limits the possibility of a creating a duplicate record.

text.text: How do I create a manual claim?

text: If you quit anytime during a manual claim creation, the system automatically assigns the incomplete claim to you. You can find it in your Inbox and on the Dashboard.

text.text: Which fields are required on the first page of the manual claim creation?

text: On the first page, all fields are required with the exception of the middle name and the social security number.

text.text: How can I enter claim information when creating a manual claim?

text: When you click Next, the system builds the claim using the information you provided. You will see the claim number on the top right of the next page. From this point forward you can add notes or attachments to this claim on any tab.

text.text: What should I do if there is a discrepancy in the patient demographics during claim creation?

text: If there is a discrepancy in the patient demographics, you will see an icon and an action that you can take.

text.text: How can I verify the entered address with USPS?

text: Any color but green indicates that an issue was found.

text.text: What should I do if I don't have insurance information for a patient during claim creation?

text: If you do not have insurance for this patient, click the Find this patient's insurance for me button. We will retrieve this information and show you the results on the COB tab.

text.text: How do I find the insurance information for a patient on the COB tab?

text: If you clicked the find insurance button on the "Patient details" tab, the results show at the top of the page under "Insurance details collected during incident". If you did not click the find insurance button on the "Patient details" tab and now you want us to search for you, no worries. You can run Insurance Discovery on the COB tab by clicking Find insurance.

text.text: What action should I take if there is a warning or low confidence score during insurance discovery?

text: If you see one of these warnings, click 'More info' to see the information provided by the payer. Check the information to ensure that this is your patient and you do want to add the results to the claim. Search results are marked with a date and held in memory. If you want to run them again, click Search again.

text.text: How do I determine the level of service when creating a claim?

text: You can determine the level of service by selecting a level of service button. You can also set up Level of Service Favorites to limit the buttons that display to only those with the level of service that your agency supports.

text.text: What is the default place of service code and how can I change it if needed?

text: The place of service will auto populate with a 41 or 42 depending on the level of service you select. If you do not want a 41 or 42, click the Place of service field and select a different code from the drop-down menu.

text.text: How can I add a diagnosis code when creating a claim?

text: You can add a diagnosis code by starting to type the diagnosis code or description and then selecting it from the list that displays.

text.text: What should I do to create a round trip in a claim?

text: To create a round trip, you need to change the units for the base rate to "2" and double the mileage if applicable.

text.text: How do I add notes or attachments to a claim during its creation?

text: You can add notes or attachments to a claim on any tab after you click Next. You can also move backwards to a previous tab if needed.

text.text: What should I do if I am not ready to submit the claim to the clearinghouse after completing it?

text: If you are not ready to submit the claim to the clearinghouse, you can click the status box, and then select the suspension reason from the list. After selecting the reason, click Complete the claim.

text.text: Where can I find incomplete claims assigned to me?

text: Incomplete claims are assigned to you automatically if you quit anytime during a manual claim creation. You can find it in your Inbox and on the Dashboard.

text.text: How do I reassign an incomplete claim to someone else during the claim creation process?

text: You can reassign an incomplete claim to someone else during the claim creation process. To do this, click on the incomplete claim in your Inbox or find it through the Dashboard. Then, click the edit icon next to the "Assigned to" field and select a name from the list. The incomplete claim will now display in the Inbox of the person you selected.

text.text: What happens if I quit during the manual claim creation process?

text: If you quit anytime during a manual claim creation, the system automatically assigns the incomplete claim to you. You can find it in your Inbox and on the Dashboard.

text.text: How can I edit the patient details, such as address or phone number, after creating the claim?

text: You can move backwards to a previous tab if needed. For example, you can move from "Level of service & diagnosis" back to "Patient details" to change a patient's address or phone number.

text.text: What should I verify in the final review of the charges section before completing a claim?

text: You should verify the payer and the charges in the final review of the charges section before completing a claim. If either are not correct, you should go back and correct the issue. Notes can be added at anytime during the creation of the claim.

text.text: How do I include an emergency indicator in a claim?

text: You can include an emergency indicator in a claim if needed.

text.text: Where can I find the notes link to add a note during claim creation?

text: You can find the notes link at the top right corner.

text.text: What happens to the claim status upon completion by default?

text: The claim status upon completion by default is "Queued for submission". If you are ready to submit the claim to the clearinghouse, you should click Complete the claim. If you are not ready, you should click the status box, and then select the suspension reason from the list.

text.text: How can I manually suspend a claim if I am not ready to submit it?

text: To manually suspend a claim, you can click the status box, and then select the suspension reason from the list. After selecting the reason, click Complete the claim.

text.text: What should I do if the payer or charges are not correct during the final review of the claim?

text: If either the payer or charges are not correct during the final review of the claim, you should go back and correct the issue using the tabs at the top of the page. You can also add notes at any time during the claim creation process.
